result.execSummary:
All charges against Brandi J Metoxen in this case have been dismissed. These charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Brandi J Metoxen is presumed innocent.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Brandi J Metoxen

records.addlTxt: Cash bond moved to 2022CF284 at Court's direction.

10:32 AM Cases called: 22CM27/22CF284 Prosecuting attorney Adam Yale Gerol in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Brandi J Metoxen in court.  Attorney Heather Dvoran in court for Brandi J Metoxen. State moves to dismiss. Court orders case dismissed.

10:20 AM Prosecuting attorney Antonella Aleman-Zientek in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Brandi J Metoxen in court.  Attorney Heather Dvoran in court for Brandi J Metoxen. State advises has received drug test results and will be filing an amended complaint.
Further proceedings scheduled for August 8, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Further proceedings on August 8, 2022 at 10:00 am.

10:24 AM Prosecuting attorney Kerra Stumbris in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Brandi J Metoxen not in court.  Attorney Heather Dvoran in court for Brandi J Metoxen. Counsel advises Defendant has been diagnosed with COVID. Counsel advises is awaiting crime lab results.  State advises has not received. Court issues and stays warrant to next date.
Further proceedings scheduled for July 5, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Further proceedings on July 5, 2022 at 10:00 am.
8:30 AM Defendant's fiance called and stated Defendant has COVID, Clerk provided zoom information. - email sent to clerk RF

10:35 AM Prosecuting attorney Kerra Stumbris appeared in court for the State of Wisconsin, Defendant Brandi J Metoxen appeared in court, Attorney Heather Dvoran for Brandi J Metoxen appeared in court. Counsel advises is awaiting testing from the State Crime Lab. State to advise if results will not be available by next date.
Further proceedings scheduled for May 5, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Further proceedings on May 5, 2022 at 10:00 am.
22R 000867  Bond posted at Sheriff's Office on 1/22/2022.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Prosecutor

records.addlTxt: Absolute sobriety. Not to possess or consume controlled substances or prescription medication w/out a valid prescription. No contact with: AM.

1:28 PM Prosecuting attorney Benjamin Lindsay appeared in court for the State of Wisconsin, Defendant Brandi J Metoxen appeared by video conference from the Ozaukee County Jail, Attorney Heather Dvoran appeared in court for Brandi J Metoxen. Defendant qualifies for PD. Counsel waives reading. Court advises of charges/penalties and finds probable cause. State recommends $500 cash bail w/conditions. Counsel requests signature bond. Counsel enters not guilty plea.
Further proceedings scheduled for March 10, 2022 at 10:00 am.
